testcase.name: Validate the application for failure scenario
testcase.classname: This feature is to test the simplilearn application for both success and failure scenario
testcase.system-out: @Browser @Sanity Scenario: Validate the application for failure scenario # src/test/java/features/Login.feature:16 Given I have launched the application # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_have_launched_the_application() And I click on login link # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_click_on_login_link() When I enter the username # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_enter_the_username() And I enter the password # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_enter_the_password() And I click the login button # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_click_the_login_button() Then I should get an error message # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_should_get_an_error_message()

testcase.name: Validate the application for failure scenario using parameters
testcase.classname: This feature is to test the simplilearn application for both success and failure scenario
testcase.system-out: @Browser @Sanity Scenario: Validate the application for failure scenario using parameters # src/test/java/features/Login.feature:23 Given I have launched the application # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_have_launched_the_application() And I click on login link # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_click_on_login_link() When I enter the username as "abc@xyz.com" # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_enter_the_username_as(java.lang.String) And I enter the password as "Abc@xyz123" # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_enter_the_password_as(java.lang.String) And I click the login button # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_click_the_login_button() Then I should get an error message as "The email or password you have entered is invalid." # stepdefs.LoginstepDef.i_should_get_an_error_message_as(java.lang.String)
